sources.title: The Secret Doctrine
sources.author: Helena Petrovna Blavatsky
sources.quote: Sirius was called the 'Dog Star.' It was the star of Mercury, or Buddha, called the 'Great Instructor of mankind.'
sources.component_reasoning: Pre-1862 reference to visible star Sirius in Theosophical context

sources.title: A Treatise on Cosmic Fire
sources.author: Alice A. Bailey (transmitted by Djwhal Khul)
sources.quote: The sun, Sirius, is the source of the Logoic mind (manas) in the same sense as the Pleiades are connected
sources.component_reasoning: Discusses Sirius system as spiritual hierarchy source without specifying component

sources.title: Esoteric Astrology
sources.author: Alice A. Bailey (transmitted by Djwhal Khul)
sources.quote: Our Hierarchy is under the supervision or spiritual magnetic control of the Hierarchy of Sirius
sources.component_reasoning: Discusses Sirius as hierarchical spiritual source without stellar component specificity

sources.title: The Cosmos of Soul: A Wake-Up Call for Humanity
sources.author: Patricia Cori (channeled by Sirian High Council)
sources.quote: six-dimensional beings dedicated to the transformation of human consciousness guardians dedicated to assist in the transformation
sources.component_reasoning: Channeled material discussing Sirian High Council without stellar component specificity

sources.title: The New Sirian Revelations: Galactic Prophecies for the Ascending Human Collective
sources.author: Patricia Cori (channeled by Sirian High Council)
sources.quote: Sirians hold us to our responsibility as guardians of this planet with sound direction and advice
sources.component_reasoning: Channeled teachings from Sirian High Council without stellar detail

characteristics.trait: Star of fertility, abundance and New Year (Egyptian Sopdet/Sothis)

sources.title: The Ancient Egyptian Pyramid Texts
sources.author: Samuel A. B. Mercer (translator)
sources.quote: Isis comes to you rejoicing for love of you she being ready as Sopdet and Horus-Soped has come forth
sources.component_reasoning: Ancient Egyptian visible star reference (pre-1862), heliacal rising tradition

sources.title: The Ancient Egyptian Pyramid Texts
sources.author: R. O. Faulkner (translator)
sources.quote: Your sister Isis comes to you rejoicing for love of you she being ready as Sothis
sources.component_reasoning: Ancient Egyptian visible star Sopdet/Sothis (pre-1862)

sources.title: The Ancient Egyptian Coffin Texts
sources.author: R. O. Faulkner (translator)
sources.quote: Sothis speaks to me in her good time at the Field of Offerings
sources.component_reasoning: Ancient Egyptian Middle Kingdom text referring to visible Sothis

sources.title: Goddess Sopdet in Ancient Egyptian Religion
sources.author: Amr Abd Elaziz Saleh
sources.edition: Journal of the Faculty of Tourism and Hotels-University of Sadat City
sources.quote: she was known since the first Dynasty as the goddess who brings the new year and the inundation
sources.component_reasoning: Academic analysis of ancient Egyptian visible star tradition

characteristics.trait: Associated with Isis, Osiris and spiritual initiation

sources.title: The Ancient Egyptian Pyramid Texts
sources.author: R. O. Faulkner (translator)
sources.quote: Sopdet as the daughter of Osiris united with the king to give birth to the morning star
sources.component_reasoning: Ancient Egyptian text identifying visible Sopdet with Osiris mythology

sources.title: The Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead
sources.author: R. O. Faulkner (translator)
sources.edition: University of Texas Press, Revised Edition
sources.quote: Isis in her name of Sothis the herald of the inundation of the Nile
sources.component_reasoning: Ancient Egyptian New Kingdom text identifying Isis with visible Sothis

characteristics.trait: Rain bringer and divine guardian (Zoroastrian Tishtrya/Tir)

sources.title: The Zend-Avesta, Part II: The Sîrôzahs, Yasts, and Nyâyis
sources.author: James Darmesteter (translator)
sources.edition: Sacred Books of the East, Volume 23
sources.quote: We sacrifice unto Tishtrya the bright and glorious star who is the seed of the waters
sources.component_reasoning: Ancient Persian visible star Sirius tradition (pre-1862)

characteristics.trait: Genetic engineers and amphibious teachers (Dogon Nommo tradition)

sources.title: The Sirius Mystery: New Scientific Evidence of Alien Contact 5,000 Years Ago
sources.author: Robert K. G. Temple
sources.quote: The Nommo are described as amphibious beings who came from the Sirius system
sources.component_reasoning: Discusses Dogon knowledge of Sirius B white dwarf companion and po tolo

sources.title: Dieu d'eau: Entretiens avec Ogotemmêli
sources.author: Marcel Griaule
sources.quote: Le Nommo descendu du ciel dans une arche apporta sur la terre les techniques et les graines
sources.component_reasoning: Anthropological record of Dogon claims about Sirius B invisible companion

sources.title: The Pale Fox (Le Renard Pâle)
sources.author: Marcel Griaule and Germaine Dieterlen
sources.quote: Digitaria is the smallest of grains corresponds to Sirius B orbits Sirius in fifty years
sources.isbn: Travaux et Mémoires de l'Institut d'Ethnologie, LXXII
sources.component_reasoning: Primary anthropological source documenting Dogon Sirius B knowledge claims

characteristics.trait: Late third-density social memory complex (Law of One)

sources.title: The Law of One, Book II (The Ra Material)
sources.author: Ra (channeled by Carla Rueckert, questioned by Don Elkins)
sources.quote: an entity from the star Sirius planetary body has approached this planetary body twice late third-density social memory complex
sources.component_reasoning: Channeled material discusses Sirius entity without specifying stellar component

sources.title: The Ra Contact: Teaching the Law of One
sources.author: Don Elkins, Carla Rueckert, Jim McCarty
sources.quote: This entity evolved from second-density vegetation forms close to what you call the tree
sources.component_reasoning: Discusses Sirius planetary body entity without stellar detail

characteristics.trait: Source of cosmic freedom and spiritual liberation

sources.title: A Treatise on Cosmic Fire
sources.author: Alice A. Bailey (transmitted by Djwhal Khul)
sources.quote: The Path to Sirius leads to cosmic rapture rhythmic bliss attributes unrevealed
sources.component_reasoning: Esoteric teachings about Path to Sirius without stellar component detail

sources.title: Esoteric Astrology
sources.author: Alice A. Bailey (transmitted by Djwhal Khul)
sources.quote: The Leo full moon is dedicated to making contact with Sirius the principle of cosmic Freedom
sources.component_reasoning: Discusses Sirius as source of spiritual energy without component specificity

disputed_points.claim: Dogon people possessed accurate astronomical knowledge of Sirius B (invisible white dwarf companion) without telescopes
disputed_points.counter_evidence: Anthropologist Walter van Beek conducted restudy in 1991 and found Dogon disagreed about which star was Sigu Tolo and stated they learned about the star from Griaule. Carl Sagan noted inconsistencies in Dogon astronomical knowledge.

sources.title: Dogon Restudied: A Field Evaluation of the Work of Marcel Griaule
sources.author: Walter E. A. van Beek
sources.quote: Though they do speak about Sigu Tolo they disagree completely with each other as to which star is meant
sources.component_reasoning: Counter-evidence regarding Dogon knowledge of Sirius B white dwarf

sources.title: Broca's Brain: Reflections on the Romance of Science
sources.author: Carl Sagan
sources.quote: Why didn't the Dogon know about the other planets closer to the Earth
sources.component_reasoning: Skeptical analysis of Dogon Sirius B knowledge claims

research_notes: Sirius demonstrates strong consensus across multiple traditions for teacher/wisdom-keeper archetype with extremely high ancient support (Egyptian Sopdet/Sothis, Zoroastrian Tishtrya). The Egyptian tradition is particularly robust with direct Pyramid Texts and Coffin Texts evidence from Faulkner and Mercer translations. The Dogon-Sirius B controversy remains disputed with strong counter-evidence from van Beek (1991, Current Anthropology) and Sagan (1979, published book). Modern channeled material (Bailey, Cori, Law of One) consistently portrays Sirius as source of spiritual hierarchy and evolutionary guidance. Astronomical component assignments: Ancient sources pre-1862 = Component A (visible star); Dogon/Temple/Griaule material regarding po tolo/digitaria = Component B (white dwarf); Modern channeled material without stellar specificity = unspecified. All sources now include ISBN, DOI/JSTOR, or translator credentials. Wikipedia and blog sources removed; only primary published sources retained.
